citation.article-title: Diversity and evolution of Bdellovibrio-and-like organisms (BALOs), reclassification of Bacteriovorax starrii as Peredibacter starrii gen. nov., comb. nov., and description of the Bacteriovorax-Peredibacter clade as Bacteriovoracaceae fam. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Peredibacter (Pe.re.di.bacâ€²ter. L. v. peredere to eat up, to devour; N.L. masc. n. bacter rod; N.L. masc. n. Peredibacter bacterium-devourer).
Consists of predatory, Gram-negative, bacteriovorous species that require a Gram-negative host as prey to complete a biphasic life cycle.
Members of the genus are soil-dwellers.
Phylogenetic rRNA gene sequence analysis shows that it forms a separate, monophyletic group within the Bacteriovoracaceae.
The morphological description of the genus is the same as that of the type strain and only species in the genus, Peredibacter starrii.
